title: Ep. 826 - A Country That Values Puppies Over People
description:
Today on the Matt Walsh Show, Anthony Fauci is coming under fire from both the left and right, and what is it that has finally made the public turn on him? The answer to that question tells us quite a bit about our culture and its priorities. Also, a Virginia court rules that a girl was in fact raped inside a bathroom in a Loudoun County school, but the media still isn’t ready to accept the story. They are now engaging in what, in any other circumstance, would be called victim blaming. And a GOP senate candidate says he doesn’t believe in the separation of church and state. He’s getting criticism for that, but he has a point. Plus, the Republican candidate for governor in Virginia is surging in the polls after leaning into cultural and social issues. Might the Republican Party finally learn a valuable lesson from that?

Today on the Matt Walsh Show, Anthony Fauci is coming under fire from both the left and right, and what is it that has finally made the public turn on him? The answer to that question tells us quite a bit about our culture and its priorities. Also, a Virginia court rules that a girl was in fact raped inside a bathroom in a Loudoun County school, but the media still isn’t ready to accept the story. They are now engaging in what, in any other circumstance, would be called victim blaming. And a GOP senate candidate says he doesn’t believe in the separation of church and state. He’s getting criticism for that, but he has a point. Plus, the Republican candidate for governor in Virginia is surging in the polls after leaning into cultural and social issues. Might the Republican Party finally learn a valuable lesson from that?
